content: We had another very strong growth quarter with revenue of $142.3 million, which fell above our original guidance of $130 million to $140 million and reflects a 22% increase quarter-over-quarter. We generated adjusted EBITDA of $18.9 million, reflecting a 55% increase quarter-over-quarter and an adjusted EBITDA margin of 13%. As I mentioned, our revenue increased by approximately 22% quarter-over-quarter versus the average rig count, which increased by approximately 13%. Our completion tool division increased revenue by approximately 15% quarter-over-quarter, driven mostly by a 33% increase in Stinger dissolvable plugs sold. Wireline revenue in the second quarter increased by approximately 23%, driven mostly by market share gains in the Permian and price increases. During the second quarter, revenue totaled $142.3 million with adjusted gross profit of $29.6 million, an increase of approximately 31% quarter-over-quarter. Cementing revenue for the quarter was $55.2 million, an increase of approximately 22%. Wireline revenue for the quarter was $26.3 million, an increase of approximately 23%. Completion tool revenue was $33.1 million, an increase of approximately 15%. Coiled tubing revenue for the quarter was $27.7 million, an increase of approximately 28%.
